page.title: 14EDUCATION THURNBY ST.LUKE'S
page.content: Our school is called St.Luke's.The original building was opened in 1865. You can read about what used to happen then in the log book.It is very interesting.The new building was opened in 1958.The village hall is used for school hall activities.There are 128 children from 4-10 and a staff of 5 teachers,including the headteacher,plus a part time teacher who takes French. Outings from school include a week for 7 year olds at Church Langton,a field study centre and a week at Woodchester in Gloucestershire for the oldest children.Local visits are made to Twycross zoo where the famous chimps who have tea on TV can be seen.We also visit famous local houses such as Belton.
